intro: Ardisia fortis, commonly known as the glossy buckeye, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to tropical regions of the Americas, including parts of Mexico and Central America. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are attractive to birds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Ardisia fortis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
